channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After fiery 2023 Norfolk Southern derailment left firefighters in dark about chemicals on the train, railroads must now immediately offer hazardous cargo details
item.description: Too often in past disasters like last year's fiery Norfolk Southern derailment in East Palestine, Ohio, firefighters risked their lives trying to extinguish a blaze without knowing the right way to respond.

item.title: Target taps Shopify to add sellers to its third-party marketplace
item.description: Target is partnering with Shopify as it looks for ways to drive online traffic and get back to sales growth.

item.title: If Nvidia stumbles, how far will the stock market fall?
Europe’s richest man Bernard Arnault just bought a quirky 3-star Parisian bistro that makes $100 roast chicken
item.description: The Parisian bistro may be more low key than LVMH's other businesses, but it has hosted many A-listers visiting the French capital.

item.title: Sweltering temperatures persist across the U.S., while floodwaters inundate the Midwest
item.description: Temperatures soared across the U.S., while residents were rescued from floodwaters that forced evacuations across the Midwest.

item.title: Stocks are having their best election year since 1976. Will the rally continue?
‘Uncertainty is underrated’: Here’s the real reason markets reward those who stick around
item.description: You may not only be underestimating uncertainty—you may also be underestimating the positive impact of embracing it.

item.title: Monday's analyst calls: Micron a top pick, Goldman says buy IBM shares
item.description: Two tech stocks were among the names being talked about by analysts on Monday.

item.title: UPS sells its Coyote Logistics business to RXO for $1 billion
Forget STEM. Head of Paris’s top tech university says the secret to France’s AI boom is a focus on the humanities
item.description: The provost of Bernard Arnault and Mistral founder Arthur Mensch's college wants students to be well-rounded.

item.title: South Korea plant fire kills 22 people after lithium battery combustion
item.description: A fire that broke out at a South Korean lithium battery plant has killed 22 people, local officials said

item.title: Wall Street sees corporate profit margins creeping toward 2021 levels
Danone and Nestle search for a way around Ozempic Revolution with high protein yogurt and vitamins against hair-loss
item.description: About 30 million Americans have taken GLP-1 drugs, sparking consumption shifts with ripple effects on retail, travel and beyond.

item.title: 'Intense' stage of Gaza fighting is close to end, Israel's Netanyahu says
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has signaled that the "intense" phase of fighting in the war-torn Gaza enclosure is close to ending.

item.title: Here's how millionaires shifted their asset allocation last year
